DOC.detailed_description: A large group non-small cell lung cancer patient treat radiotherapy . Delivery high radiation dos need obtain local control , due large tumor nodal volume often impossible without cause unrepairable damage normal tissue mediastinum , spinal cord , esophagus lung . Although every tumor different respect speed grow spread , obvious time play important role cancer therapy . Recently report disease progression increase tumor volume occur time interval diagnosis treatment . ( 1 , 2 ) This could lead less optimal radiation treatment consequently impact overall survival . Moreover , increase number diagnostic procedure , aim obtain accurate information tumor extension biology , well use sophisticated labor intense radiation technique could prolong time interval clinical symptom start treatment . However , influence new diagnostic procedure apply radiotherapy technique wait time yet know . The investigator therefore want investigate 1 ) time trend wait time NSCLC patient , 2 ) correlation wait time use advance diagnostic therapeutic procedure , 3 ) correlation wait time overall survival . The hypothesis study : 1 . The diagnostic delay NSCLC patient increase last 12 year . 2 . The preparation time radiotherapy NSCLC patient increase last 12 year . 3 . Prolonged wait time associated bad overall survival outcome . The IKL collect data wait time treatment NSCLC patient treat 2001 2004 . These data use project . In addition , MAASTRO lung database contain information patient treat 2006 2010 . Additional information diagnostic procedure radiation treatment preparation collect review patient chart . For study data request submit IKL access MAASTRO patient data ( chart EMD ) need . The investigator aim collect follow variable : Date consultation pulmonologist ; Date multidisciplinary meeting ; Date first consultancy radiotherapy ; Date start radiotherapy ; Information diagnostic procedure ( PET/CT/Pathology/EBUS/EUS ) ; Information RT procedure ( 3Dconventional/IMRT ) ; General patient characteristic ; Overall survival
